Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, children, now that I have completed this book, which is the last of the science of medicine, for the completion of which I have labored long, and through its explanations and declarations, it is clear to me that I complete for you here this treatise, which is a part of my surgical operations.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For the operation of surgery is established in our region and in our times as entirely private, despite the importance of the science of it and the evident traces of it; and there have been no substantial descriptions of it except in some small accounts in the works of the Ancients, which corrected many errors and hesitations, but have closed the understanding of it and lengthened its practice.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And it is evident to me that I should vivify that order in this treatise according to the way of explanation and declaration and abbreviation; and for the forms of the surgical instruments such as cautery tools and other implements of the work to be added through the declaration and preparation, which are necessary causes.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	More than that, the reason why a good craftsman does not place his hand well in this our time is because the art of medicine is long and that his actor before this must be exercised in the science of anatomy, which Gualia knew, entering that he was acquainted with the youth of the members and their forms, and the conjunction and separation of them; and had knowledge of the bones, the nerves, and the tendons, and the number of them, and their integrity; and of the arteries and veins, active and quiet, and of the places of the contraction of them.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this, Hippocrates says that in the small work, but more so in the art of the hand.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	More than that, we have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for who does not know what we said about anatomy will easily fall into error, which can lead to the deaths of many people, as I have seen too many such cases. For some are formed in this science but fall back into the errors of those sciences and experiences.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	For you saw a doctor who fell ill and inflicted an ap斯塔西奥病于一个妇女的颈部，因误切了一些颈动脉，致使妇女流血过多而死。
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And there was another doctor who almost removed a stone from a man who had been in his state for a long time, and the stone was large, and it came to him, and he extracted that stone using a piece of the bladder, so that that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And I have already called for the stone to be extracted, and I see that due to the size of the stone and the position of the patient, he will likely die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And there was another doctor who took a stipend from a duke of our land for surgery, and he came upon a black slave who had a fracture in the patient's thigh; and because of the doctor's ignorance, he extracted the fracture, over the wound, with pillows and splints of strong structure, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then the dislocation according to his desires, and then the reattachment, and then let it rest for a few days, and command us to release the ligament; and thus remain until the thigh and foot are well healed, and proceed to recovery.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and prepared to release the ligament, and tranquility and an attempt to alleviate his pains was achieved.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	But however, since corruption was confirmed in the member, I could not restrain that, and did not cease to walk the corruption in the member during the illness.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And I saw another doctor who incised a cancerous abscess, and it became ulcerated over several days, during which the evil increased greatly in him and in his lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	The cause is that the pain is purely of melancholic humor, and does not affect everything entirely, but rather affects a member that suffers from being attacked by it.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you that the operation be devised in two deviations: one where the operation is associated with health, and one where the work is perilous in the major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And I have already existed here in all this chapter where the operation is filled with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to keep this and leave that, so that the leaves do not find a way to speak against you and dishonor you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore take your weapons with diligence and protection of God, and your patients with joy and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way through the grace of God seeking salvation and praiseworthy success, and lay aside the terrible illnesses difficult to heal, and oppose your weapons to what fears you, so that sitting in your faith and in your name you do not falter: for more remains to your glory, and greater still in the world and beyond in your sanctities.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Gualia already dissected in some surgical cases:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat illness wrongly, so that bad doctors are not named.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have already dedicated this treatise according to three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the treatise, and first of the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter ordered in the foot, regarding the forms of the instruments and the tools of the cautery, and what is necessary in the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, on drying and perforation, and on suction cups, and on plaigs, and on extraction of arrows and similar, all chaptered and ordered by the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	The division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the cure of tortoises and similar; chapter ordered by the head between the feet, and by the forms of the instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On the cautery with fire and with sharp medicine, and a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With that, he begins the treatment of the entire work.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Know the quality of those coals for the cautery and the harms from them, and in what condition the cautery should be prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, I say that the discourse on the quality of the cautery coal and its harm is long and prolix, subtle by science, and secretly hidden; and much has already been said about it by wise men, and they are in disagreement. For my part, I content myself with a little from their sermons, to avoid excessive length.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And thus say that cautery benefits all complexions universally which is of or has matter, except two complexes, which are complexes of seminal matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the complex of gout and dry matter, it becomes desiccated; for some said that cautery is beneficial for that, while others said the opposite, that cautery is not suitable in illness which is due to quality and dryness, for the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it is inappropriate that such an illness, which is gout and dry, be healed by what is hot and dry.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And say to those who say the opposite, that by cautery one is cured in all gout and dry illness that comes in men's bodies, for when you compare the body of a man to its humors in relation to the complex of fire, you find the body hot.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say according to his speech, for I have already experienced this several times myself.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, I do not claim to have experienced this as one who has been extensively trained in the Capitol of Cautery through recent exercise, and who knows the diversity of human complexions and the disposition of illnesses in their manifestations, and the causes of those, and the accidents related to them, and the span of time for those.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other complications, there is no need for fear, and especially in wet and inflammatory diseases, since all doctors are agreed on those, and do not differ regarding the use of cautery in such cases.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Understand, children, that the secret of curing by cautery with fire and its goodness lie in the burning medical instrument, for the fire is simple, its action reaching only the member being cauterized and causing no significant harm to other members it touches.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Yet the action of the burning medical instrument reaches to those members which it touches, and strongly makes come into the affected member a disease that is difficult to cure and quickly afflicts it.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Yet fire, by its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does nothing but cause superfluous heat. We are already well aware of this through experience and long service in studying the art regarding the true causes; and for this reason, I excuse myself from the length of my discourse. If it were not that this is not written at liberty in this pause, and to reveal your secret about fire, its quality of operation on bodies, and its expulsion, which you use to expel diseases, I would deliver a philosophical demonstration, which would be useful for your people.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that they disagree about the time at which it is convenient to perform cautery and when is the best season of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And I say that cautery is convenient at all times, because the damage due to accidental weather changes is submerged in the youth of what is affected by the cautery, and especially if the cautery is for pains or necessary pains, strong wounds, and fissures, which do not suffer delay because it is feared that those caused by malice are greater than small damage entering through time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus do not trust in these, sons, for they esteem only the common people and the foolish doctors, since they say that the illness that is cured by cautery is not constant at all times, and they withhold this knowledge.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the reason is not thus because they consider it so, for cautery is not but a method in medicine which alters the composition and dries the humors, which are the cause of venous pains.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	But still, excessive cautery over medicine for the swiftness of its validity and virtue of its operation and greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that the patient's illness returns at some point in time, according to the nature of the illness, its location, and its virtue, as well as what is prepared in the body from the aggregation of superfluities in it, and what is received by it in its acquisition through food and likenesses of those causes; but if the illness where cautery is administered is a subtle illness in a member with few superfluities and humidities, like cautery for toothache due to pain and similar to that, it is possible that such pain does not return, but this is done in small quantities.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And more common speech is that cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is the language of surgeons, not what we understand by it, for I believe it is not a cure that helps either medicine or any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the cause is the opposite of this; and the understanding that cautery is the last remedy of medicine is only when one administers the methods of cure for some illnesses, and those medicines do not work, and at the end of the cause, one administers cautery, which helps in that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And at this point, the last remedy of medicine is a cautery, not according to the understanding which I understand of the vulgar and too many of the foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And the ancients said that a cautery of gold is better than one made of iron, and they did not say this only because of the equality of gold and the sublimity of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they said that the place for a cautery does not hurt much, since it is not absolutely severed, for I have applied it and tested it, and found that it does not do so in all bodies as in others, and a gold cautery is good and better than iron thus they say; but when you make a cautery with fire of gold, it is not up to you, for it ignites according to the quantity you want due to the reactivity of the gold, and it prepares to receive flame; and if you adjust over the ignition, the gold melts by the fire, and cases in the fire some sheets so that the artisan can cut by the occupation of that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for this, you should apply the iron cautery more lightly and more precisely to the correct position of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And I have already ordered this chapter concerning the cautery according to other chapters, and I have ordered those of the foot in the caput, so that I delay the request of the patient what he wants from me.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	Of the cautery for head pain due to cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cautery addresses the cold and humidity over the servery accident of which there are two causes, these being the cause of soda and many traumatic fluxes, called corissa, from the head to the parts of the neck and the ears flowing, and many sleepiness, and tooth pain, and the gullet, and universally all illness that comes through coldness, such as paralytically, soda, and apoplexy, and similar symptoms in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The form of this cautery is as follows: first, you command the patient to be evacuated with a medicinal laxative for the head, for three or four nights, according to the power of the illness and the age of the patient and their habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then command him to place his head on a pillow, and place that cushion between your hands on a sloping bench so that he rests his hands on his own foot.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then place the edge of your palm near his mouth on the razor between his heels.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	But more importantly, since the right place has been found, mark that place with a needle, and then heat the olive cautery of which this is the form:
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place the heated cautery over the marked spot with a needle, in such a way that it descends gradually, and your hand is gradually pressed firmly, while you rotate it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then lift your hand slightly and examine the spot, and if you see any part of the bone being revealed through the skin, lift your hand as much as the amount of flesh has been burned away. If not, return your hand to that iron or another, if it is cooled, so that what I have said can be seen on the bone.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little of salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place yourself over the inflamed wound and leave it there until the scar of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the area with ointment of tetrafarmacum until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And we have said that when the wound is opened wide, it heals better, for it is better and more beneficial.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the joint should be cauterized inside the bone, and that the cautery should remain until a part of the bone's surface is charred.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then scrape what is burnt from the bone, and then cure it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And others say that the cautery should reach the marrow, pressing forcefully into the bone until it chars, and this is the method of Alphcatai.
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they believe that from that place exhale the vapors of the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And let the wound be kept open for a long time, and soon it will be cured once it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	But I have not seen these two kinds of cautery for all, only in some men according to the way of fear; and leave that one, I advise you, it is better for health when it is; whereas the head is developed by solution of continuity of the head as we have testified in other members, and especially when the head of the patient is of cold nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the first kind of cautery is safer and better, I advise you; use that one and perform that work for health.
Capitol segon.	Capitalize second.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When chronic and long-lasting pain occurs in the entire head, and this is prolonged in the patient, and he uses bandages, pillows, head purges, plasters, poultices, leeches, gloves, and other remedies, and especially if the head has already been cauterized with a cautery that does not improve him from any of those causes, then consider whether the head of the patient is of strong constitution in its nature; and if it is not cold or does not have great inflammation, then that cautery should be replaced by another.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize that on the top of his head between where the vein is parted.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the vein and uncover the quantity which we have counted, and cauterize that with a cautery at the back part of the head in the place which is called vas, — and this is the place where suction is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And move your hand in this way, but do not uncover the skull, for the patient experiences great pain different from the pain of all other head cauterizations.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will say this about the cauterization in its place, for I know that the cauterization of the horns of the head and the occiput is a finer cauterization than that which cauterizes the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.
Capitol ters.	Top of the head.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization for new migraine.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When there is a sharp pain at the back of the head or a dull pain inside the skull, the head should be treated with medicinal powders to purge it, and then the other treatment I have described for diseases should be administered; and if this does not help, cauterization in these two ways may be applied: either with a burning acute medicine, or with a iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	May a cautery that burns in medicine be that you take a piece of aloes, incinerate it, and abridge the extremities of it from both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then place the location of the pain on the temple with a lancet laid gently there, and let the needle be hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then strengthen above the place stopped by descending constriction, and leave it for the space of three hours; then remove the aloes, and let the wound remain for two or three days, and then place your hand under it submerged between the borders until the area becomes warm.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then cure that wound by anointing it until it is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, do what some burning medicines allow, which I have written in the second treatise of burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	May the cautery be performed according to this manner: ignite the cautery of which this is the form:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	and it is called a knuckle, because the head of it has the form of a small crystal and in the middle part there is a slight prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	And then place your hand over the locus of the pain, and retract it—so that the artery left is not burned—and rotate the small iron gradually with speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity that is burned due to the severity of the burn is considerable, lift your hand so that the artery left is not burned, so that there be no flow of blood.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then soak it in salt water and place it over the locus, and leave it for three days; then place it near a warm spot, and cover it with ointment until it heals.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you do, cauterize at the tip of the knife blade according to the cautery, and guard against cutting the artery in this not-so-old migraine.

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	Of the cautery treatment for ancient headache.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os. Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme. De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization for pains in the ears.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to cold and it is treated with conservative methods and another treatment as described in the division, and if the pain does not subside, then apply the cautery, which is called puncta. E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna. Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cautery for the wound.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The wound which is cured and treated with a cautery is only due to the substances that flow through phlegm, as we have said in the divisions of diseases.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid using the cautery for the substance that flows due to dryness or spasms of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you cure that substance of the wound with jerris, capipurgi, and guarismes, and your treatment does not bring relief, then when you treat the disease with three cauteries: the first, the hole of the ear; the second, a small opening in its vicinity; and the third, the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And place your cautery on the opposite side of the malaise, for relief only comes to the part that appears healthy.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cautery is to apply the cautery on the outer side of the ear near a small area above the corner of the mouth, and on the temple, where the length of the application is according to the length of the upper lip, and then place your hand over the area until the quantity of the matter of the scabby lesion is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the method of the cautery, and it is specific to the surgeon, the form of whose practice is described below.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	But more subtle is that you use just a little, as if you could see it; and cut with the knife to avoid unnecessary roughness.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And place your hand over the area as described, keeping it treated until it is healed.

De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	Of the cautery for nasal odor.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat that as we said in the division and your treatment is not effective, then prepare and give to drink the cochias to the patient for three nights; and shave the head, and cauterize it with a medium cautery and an olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And cauterize that with a flower cautery on two cauteries above the eyebrows, leaving the hair a little.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to burn that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the flower cautery is used in this way.
Capitol .xv.	Capitol.xv.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Of the cautery for softening the eyelids of the eyes.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by illness or humidity, then cauterize that eyelid with a cautery similar to this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, cauterize that over the two eyebrows with a small one from two cauteries in total, and let them be long from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And let the length of each cautery be according to the size of the eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too much with your hand on the cautery, but according to the amount that the inner part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Capitol. XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	For the cautery of the eyelid of the eye when the skin is converted to parts inside and palm of the hand.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the skin of the eye is converted to parts inside, I must treat the eye according to two methods: either with a cautery or with burning medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If the cautery is from fire, command the patient before this that they let their skin be cleaned as those which are bathed, entered while they are extended and equalized; and if you pinch it there, then strengthen the heels with a bandage so that it does not get damaged while the skin is growing.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	So when they are grown and equalized, then place the head of the patient in a reclining position, and around the eyes of the heels of the cautery tent, mark with this sign the shape of a leaf of hawthorn, making it the beginning of the mark proper for the skin.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And around place a small amount of honey or mucilage of flax on the heel.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then heat the cautery with which this is done.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize over the figure which was marked, little by little in stages, until the surface of the wound is burned like a hawthorn leaf, entirely apparent properly.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of health from your work is that you see the eyelid of the heel already contracted and the hairs on it raised after the puncture of the heel.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And lift your hand and leave it there for three days, and place it over the wound between that the scar is eradicated.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And apply ointment there until it is healed.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	But if it returns through the skin for some cause near their origin and the eyelid becomes softened, then make another time the cautery over that area just as you did first.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	But if the skin is on the eyelid, then cauterize that area until it is raised to its natural place and is equalized, so that the skin does not cover the heel.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicine is that you command the patient to let the skin be prolonged and equalized, and then make it of linen cloth in the shape of a laurel leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then take known soap and a live caustic paste about an ounce. Mix these well, do this quickly so it is not diluted; spread this over the parchment which is made thus in the shape of a mulberry leaf, place that on one or both; let the root of the patient be in the middle.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place the aforementioned on the medicine and press it slightly so that the patient feels the bite of the medicine, for the bite is upon it thus like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And thus, to perceive that the atrophy feels the bite, then let the medicine go and press it on the patient's chest as previously mentioned; therefore, when the bite ceases, then return the medicine and wash the area with water; then consider if the eyelid has been raised as it is washed; if so, apply heat or incision, for then it is good; and if not, return to the place where no pressure of the medicine was applied and ensure that your operation is not compromised and contract the area.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then place your hand over the joint where the dislocation has been removed, and cure that with an ointment or something else until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And you must, in performing your operation, keep watch with great diligence so that no error in medicine occurs. If the eyelid becomes softened and some cause of the skin puffs up in the eye, then reapply your medicine to that place where the eyelid has become softened, and do it in the same manner as at the beginning, and soon let it heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	This is the way of using the mulberry leaf.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that the eyelids of humans are diverse in size and smallness, and therefore the operation should be performed according to this.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And the way of correcting it will not be hidden from those who study in this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cautery treatment of a fistula in the lacrimal gland of the eyelid.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you cure a fistula as we have said in the divisions of diseases and do not apply your cure, then when you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to place his head in your lap, and let some minister hold the back of his head between your hands in such a way that it is neither hurt nor agitated.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place the cautery on the vein in the foot or on the wart of a blister over the heel.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then ignite the cautery, the form of which is as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is round, as formed like a cane or a bird's claw, from one end of which the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you wish, penetrate it into the other end.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want, let it be drawn out like a tent.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	But nonetheless, that which is concave is better for your work.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And then press the fistula if it is opened, and draw from it clean and dry that which comes out.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not opened, then open it and extract the pus from it.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	And then place the well-ignited cautery over it, and hold your hand a little above the nose, so that your hand does not err or the patient be disturbed, and then place the cautery on the nostrils and destroy that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so, if at the beginning of your cautery it enters into the mouth, that is good; and if not, then iterate the cautery one or two times, as needed; and leave it thus for three days, and then place your hand over that spot to keep it dry until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if more than ten days have passed and it is not healed, then place the sharp corrosive medicine over it until the bone is revealed and removed according to your decree in your treatise.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	And another way to treat a fistula, which some first doctors will say: identify the location of the fistula and do it there; then place your hand gently over that small fissure through which it is shaped: put in that location one ounce of melted lead; keep your hand well on this with good retention, so that the bad humor does not enter where the melted lead does not reach; and pause above the opening of the bad humor as if in white of egg or water, because lead adheres to the location of the fistula and heals it through a marvelous healing.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed as we have said of the cautery and the cure, well and good; but if not, then it is necessary to administer a nasal draught and reduce the fistula to the nose's body according to what will come in its proper place.
Capitol .xviii.	Chapter XVIII.
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	On the cautery treatment of the wound from a boil.
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Small vesicles often occur in the lips, and particularly in the lips of children.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Then when you cure those cracks as we have said in the divisions and your cure does not improve, then ignite the small surgical cautery according to this form that is taught:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	And let its cavity be according to the subtlety of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Then place that hot hand over those cracks until the cautery reaches the base of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with cerate until it is healed.
Capitol .xix.	Chapter XIX.
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	On the cautery treatment for a fistula in the mouth.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When an abscess is located in the root of the uvula or on the palate or in the roots of the teeth, and subsequently forms a boil, eventually breaks open, heals over, and then becomes chronic, forming a fistula, and your treatment does not improve the cure, then ignite the cautery according to the quantity received in the fistula, place that ignited cautery into the track of the fistula, and keep your hand there until the burning iron reaches the base of it. Do this one or two times at the end. Then cure that with what we have said about the treatment until it is healed.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And therefore if the abscess is incised and healed, well; but otherwise, it is necessary to uncover the place and cauterize the corrupted bone according to what will come in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	capitol .xx.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	Cauterization of the teeth and softening of the gums.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the gums are softened by humidity and the teeth are decayed, and you have cured those with medicines without effect, then place the patient's head in hot water, and soon ignite the cautery in the form which will be described below. Try to pause the cautery over the tooth and insert it into that area strongly burning, keeping it just a little while so that the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeatedly apply the cautery several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should close his mouth with salt water and keep it for an hour, then spit it out, as the decayed tooth is sealed and the softened gum tightened, and the corrupted humidity is dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter XXI.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	Of the cautery treatment for tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to inflammation or there is a swelling, or if medical treatment does not bring relief, the cautery treatment for that area can be performed in two ways: either with a cow's horn cautery, or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	The cow's horn cautery is done by taking a horn from a cow and boiling that part where the iron was attached. Then take a piece of it and wrap it around the end of the cautery, and immerse that portion in the heated horn, placing it over the painful tooth quickly before it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And then repeatedly apply it several times until the heat from the fire permeates to the root of the teeth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you do, soak some wool or a piece of leather in the horn mentioned above, and place it over the painful tooth. Then hold the hot iron over that area until the heat reaches the root of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	Moreover, however, the cautery with fire, you must attend to the tip of the iron or reed, and in its body some coarse substance be placed so that the heat of the fire does not reach the opening of the patient.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	And then shape the cautery as it will come, and place that part over the tooth and put your hand inside so that the cautery is well lubricated; and do this several times to prevent the pain from worsening on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that through the impression of that cautery, the patient opens their mouth well and keep it that way for about an hour; and this is the form of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And cauterize as much as you can determine or wish to.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the form of the catheter:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter 22.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cautery treatment for exstrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hernias are due to phlegm and humors that are not obedient to digestion by medicines, and you have the digestion of those lightly, then apply the cautery to the form of which this follows, having two open extremities so that smoke comes from one end through the other, and place that ignited over that abscess for a moment, and another if you find it necessary before it reaches the root of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit. E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the form of the cannula or cautery is as follows.
Capitol .xxiii.	Capitol XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of the cautery for hoarseness and the constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the humidity of the venous blood affects the channel of the lung, and especially when this is due to a complex coldness, then it is necessary that the patient be treated with laxative medicines at the beginning, and then cauterize the depression below the diaphragm in the compressed area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And see to it that you do not apply the cautery to the diaphragm or burn the rib cage, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery at the junction of the neck and the lower part of the spine.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery for the rib cage should be applied according to the previous method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with what was preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On the cauterization for lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by cold humidity, and the patient does not have fever or consumption, and it is an old lung ailment, then cauterize that with two cauteries over the furcula in the compressed areas of the chest; and with another cautery in the middle location of the foot between two mammary regions; and let the cautery for the rib cage be applied according to the form previously mentioned.

E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And let the cautery having three edges; for the cautery is made in this manner: with one passage you can make three cauterizations according to this form.
Capitol .xxv.	Capitol.xxv.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cautery for tililic, which is the head of the helper.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the helper is dislocated due to lubricating humidity and does not return in the hour of its return, you must reduce its dislocation while it is about to naturally return, and then by a small movement, it will be dislocated as it strives to return, as we have testified. First, reduce the dislocation, and then lay the patient on their back or on their side; and lift the chin which is in the inner part of the tililic to the outer parts above the thumbs of your left hand if the joint is dislocated inwardly.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then heat the cautery having two heads; this is its form:

De cauterizacio del stomac.	Of cautery of the stomach.
Quan veno en l’estomac freg e motas humiditatz entro que aquel extrazo de la sua compleccio e so multiplicatz raumases a lu, e si tu continuas las manieyras de curacio e no confereyso, lahoras cove que le malaute sia sobre le sieu dos ressupinat, e extenda las suas mas e las suas coysas, e aprop cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris: an un cauteri dejos le pietz per la quantitat d’un dit am cauteri clavilh, e am dos cauteris dejos del dos costatz del cauteri, entro que vengua la figura de cauteri triangulada; e elonga entre els que no sian ajustatz que faran poyredura.	When pain in the stomach is caused by moisture and humors that extract from its composition and multiply within it, and if you continue with the methods of cure and they do not bring relief, then you will find that the patient lies on his back, extends his hands and his legs, and then cauterize that area three times: in one cauterization place the foot with the width of a finger with a pointed cautery, and in two cauterizations place on both sides of the cautery so that the figure becomes triangular; and extend those not closely aligned to cause suppuration.
E si la profunditat del cauteri la quantitat de les dos terses de la grocesa de la codena.	And if the depth of the cautery is the width of two-thirds of the thickness of the cord.
E sia la figura del cauteri segon aquesta forma ses addicio, E si vols, cauteriza am gran cauteri en le mieg loc del estomac segon aquesta forma; et aquest sia un cauteri segon la forma de cercle segon aquesta forma:	And let the figure of the cautery be as follows: If you wish, cauterize with a large cautery in the middle of the stomach according to this form; this should be a circular cautery according to this form.
E sia cauterizat l’estomac punctan ad aquel que de aquest cauteri es spaventat: e es que tu senhes sobre l’estomac punt segon la quantitat que voles am tenta, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en les puntz; e aprop cura aquel am la curacio qu’es precedita entro que sia sanat. De cauterizacio del fietge fret.	Of the cautery for the sole of the foot.
Quan endeve en le fietge dolor per fregiditat o per humiditat o per grossa ventositat entro que de la sieua normal compleccio sia getat per egressio superflua, e es curat le malaute am aquo que havem dit e no comfereys, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e senhes am tenta tres cauteris segon aquesta forma et aquesta quantitat meteyssa sobre le fietge dejos dels ipocondres, la hon perve le decubit de home. E sia l’espazi le qual es entre quascun cauteri segon la grossetut del dit, e sia le cauteri segon la longitut del cors dreyta.	And the space between each cautery according to the thickness of the finger, and the cautery according to the length of the body straight.
E no compremas la tua am le cauteri mot.	And do not make the cautery too hot.
E si la quantitat de aquo que es adhurit la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena, e no y sia pus ajustat; e si le malaute stant sobre les pes de lu; e si no es estant, lahoras sia jassent, le qual ja ha extendudas las suas coysas, e eleve les sieus brasses. E a tu es possible que cauterizes aquestz cauteris am cauteri cutellar, quan es am tu subtilitat e prudencia en l’art.	And it is possible that you may sear these cauteries with a surgical cautery when your subtlety and prudence in the art are sufficient.

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the perforation of an abscess in the foot with a cautery.
Quan endeve excitura o apostema en le fietge e voles saber si aquel apostema es en le carn del fietge o en la tunica de lu, lahoras si es en la carn del fietge, le malaute atrobo gravitat e dolor ses acuitat.	When there is inflammation or an abscess in the foot and you want to know whether the abscess is in the flesh of the foot or in the skin, then if it is in the flesh of the foot, the patient experiences a severe swelling and acute pain.
E si es en la tunica del fietge, am la dolor es acuitat gran e vezes que ja afatiguatz les metges la cura de lu.	And if it is in the skin of the foot, then the pain becomes very acute, often to such an extent that it exhausts even the doctors with its treatment.

E no cove que de aquesta forma de cauteri use sino aquel del qual le estudi en l’art de medicina es prolonguat, e en las mas del qual motas malautias an conogut; mays aquest am esperiment alcunas veguadas sia ardit sobre aquesta operacio, mays empero leyssa aquela deves nos, e es miels.	And ensure that only those who have studied this in the art of medicine use it. Most of them are aware of the maladies associated with improper use. However, I have observed from experience several times its use in this operation, so I leave this to your discretion, for the better.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cautery for piles.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit. This is what you should do: take from the branches of aristologia a long piece of wood, which is found there, and let it have the thickness of a finger.

De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of the cautery of the vagina.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there is venous congestion in the vagina with cold and humidity, and thus conception is prohibited, and the menstruation is corrupted, and the induction of labor is delayed, and joint pain occurs due to these conditions, then it should be cauterized with three cauteries around the navel circuit, as we have said for the bladder cautery; and a cautery over the lower part of the big toe, or with two cauteries, and the cautery should be pointed.

De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of the cautery treatment for dislocation of the ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When mucous humors infiltrate the area of the ankle and cause displacement of its location, a sign of this is that the swelling extends over the other leg when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the location of the dislocation is treated with the affected foot.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle. De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of the cautery for the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain occurs in the sciatic nerve and its cause is cold and humidity, the patient is treated with what we have said and you do not mix it, and this is ancient practice. Then apply a cautery to the area where you sense the presence of large humors through pills made from rotten substances or artificial ones resembling them.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	The method of the cautery in this case is according to two methods: either a cautery with burning medicines, or a cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	Sir according to two scientific methods, of which one is to make three triangular cauteries over the broad part of the leg in this form; and do so with good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And let the space between each cautery be the width of one finger, whether the cautery is small or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	More often, apply the cautery in the middle of each location on the back of the thigh, as there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.
