Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Form of a ray which conforms to the proportion of that which is drilled into the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And its extremity is triangular and sharply pointed.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of steel from India, and similarly grooved like all the causes we have said about razors, incisors, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	For the incision of extremities and the jointing of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities suffer pain either from an intrinsic cause or from an extrinsic one, or as you have medicated that corruption through the cure of those medicines and the cure did not bring relief, or sometimes the corruption goes to the member which you do not perceive by any cause, then you must enter that member into this so that it accedes the corruption, in order to expel the evil either through death or malice which is greater misfortune of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	The sign of him upon whom this occurs is that the member turns black before it is cauterized as if it were already burned, or you may notice the blackness in that area where the burn has entered that part and taken possession of the whole body; therefore, you must immediately intervene for that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, if the cause of the corruption is a blow from some venomous causes such as from a scorpion, a viper, or a rattle snake, and similar to this.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the blow is in the extremity of the finger, then you must cut the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it enters the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And when you approach the hand, then incise that of the elbow, and do not give space for corruption to enter within the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you prefer that, then incise the arm between the knee and the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if corruption passes and surrounds the knee, then in that case it is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause other than this for cure is a measure of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do for the foot when corruption prefers the sole of the foot, then incise that between one of the toes.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes in the sole of the foot, then incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it enters the heel, then incise the leg between the joint of the heel.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if corruption has already reached the heel, then there is nothing but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of incising the member or sewing it is that you hold the ligament in the part you want to incise, and leave another where you wish; extend a ligament to the parts left, and extend the minister another one there; you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments until all the flesh is completely exposed; then it should be incised or sewn.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And ensure that a cloth is placed from all sides over it so that it does not touch the affected area, and that the wound and abscess are properly aligned when coming to the patient.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	And if you encounter a flow of blood while working, then cauterize the area frequently, or place some constricting powders on it to stop the blood; then return to your treatment until it is completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then tie the injured member with a ligament as is convenient, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you that if someone finds a black spot on their foot, this accident which you and I have advised about, is caused by a burning that resembles the combustion of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption accidently first occurs within the said intestine.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that person prepares himself to wait until the healing goes to the member with the urgency of his pain and from the intensity of his discomfort, and the inflammation in that part enters the joint, and the wound heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time that corruption accidently occurs in the hand indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it comes to me, and I perform the task of reflecting on that excess to be administered where it is placed on the hand of the medicines; and the excess does not reflect but begins to go into another part where it began in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And they make me inflame the hand of the patient, and I do not want to do this fearing the reflection of that excess, more because I fear the inflammation of the hand of the patient, for the virtue of gout was potent.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he wakes from me, he returns to his land and tells me that that person prepared and inflamed his hand entirely, and he was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have added this narrative only to serve as an aid regarding what is known about this illness, and as a guideline by which it may be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the care of the bowels and the quality of the enema with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshly members and the space of the abscess is prolonged, collecting pus, and then it breaks and perforates, and the pus is extracted, leaving the location void as if it were a vessel, and the cloth above it remains like a thin cover, and no further corruption is reached, nor does it imprint on bone or nerve or sinew, it is called a sinus, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	Otherwise, if the space is prolonged such that corruption presses into some member, then it is called a fistula.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is to insert that cloth entirely as if it were stirred, especially when made thin and formed like a cloth, and ensure that it does not adhere to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the clog adheres and that the corruption has not succeeded by a later consequence, and on the clog it has passed through facing, then you cure that with a cleansing enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the hand that exudes has a foul odor, then treat it with an enema using a medicinal Egyptian remedy which consists of oil, wine, and honey, each part in equal quantities, placed in a vessel and heated over a fire until the medicine boils and reaches the desired temperature.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take what is necessary from it and dissolve the medicine in water and honey; then treat the sinus with this, strengthen its orifices, and leave the medicine in it for about two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then extract that medicine completely; do this for several days until the sinus is purified and the swelling subsides.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat. E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient does not tolerate the Egyptian medicine nor the water of the ash, then prepare that mixture with water and honey mixed with a third part of myrrh, and prepare that mixture with wine and honey mixed, for it is the property of honey to modify and wash, and wine makes the sinus adhere, especially when there is an excess ofstringiness and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have applied it several times and you are sure that the sinus is sufficiently cleansed, then use a mixture that promotes flesh growth in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And you take ointment of dyafinicon, dissolve that mixture with diluted oil and stringy wine; or you use a mixture for clistering with some medicines and other ointments that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the sinus开口较大，不能容纳导管，那么你逐渐用小铁棒扩大那个开口，并在扩大的过程中，在开口处放置包裹着埃及药膏或百里香膏的湿敷布。

E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the stream flows is elevated above the parts above, then dry that at the lower place where it is located so that the stream can flow into it; when the stream is contained in the curvature of the sinus, the flesh will be generated in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinus in the area of the lower part as you wish, then you should perforate and prepare the member for the preparation by which the stream flows through it slightly according to what is at your disposal and so that no cause of the stream is retained.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidative medicines that be placed over the sinus conveniently as you wish, extending them on linen cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such great quantity as to cover the entire sinus; then cut with scissors along the right side of the opening of the sinus a slit slightly wider than the opening of the sinus; then extend on another piece of linen the leon ointment according to the size of the slit, and place it over the area far from the opening of the sinus so that the stream is alleviated and does not hinder the cloth greatly, but only for a few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May he who is over the aperture of the sinus, whom you warm at all times so that it does not come out what is inserted in it from the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from it is much or little, or is digestible, or is non-digestible.

E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent. E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel. And make it seem in that action, when there is no hand, use dauphinycon ointment, and when myrrh and aloes and saffron are present, mix them all and powder them over the honey while it is on fire, and then lay this over cloth and strengthen it on the sinus; and lay this on the honey which you have mixed and made thick, and strengthen that with cloth.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is administered to her with long artery juice and root of celestial lily (and this is the celestial lily) and powder of ergot and centaury, and use those simples or adjusted, press them and sift over honey which I have recommended; and apply it.

And if the sinus is prolonged and does not heal with this treatment, then you should know that the corruption is in the root of it, and make an inquiry into the bones or other hard members or ligaments; then you cure it with a fistula cure, as was said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	For the treatment of tumors, nail attrition, and incision of the digit with sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici is an abscess which leaves the nail of the finger or toe, and is hard in other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less prized, or is corrupted from a carbuncle, or is corrupted, and a branch enters where you corrode the root of the nail, and thoroughly corrupts that part entirely, and thoroughly allows its corruption to penetrate into the bone within which there is an offensive smell, and the extremity of the finger is cut off, and the color of it becomes jaundiced.

Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput. If at the joint upon percussion or friction there is intense pain, then at the beginning lanced the patient, and quickly draw out the fluid from the joint with a sharp needle by transverse sectioning above in juice, and guard that the section does not reach into the flesh left in the joint, for you will thereby cause the patient intense pain, which is due to the nature of excess adjusted flesh in that place; and cure that area with what alleviates pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	Moreover, by "adjusted," which is inherent in many people, the flesh is very heavy, and the bones are very light, or the joint is very heavy.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of it is located in the region of the joint, or the nature of it is situated in certain nodules of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	Moreover, that which is located in certain nodules of the fingers is not severe, while that which is located in the joints is more painful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those that are fleshy, the section is light, and you should incise it with a broad needle.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	More difficult for one born near the joint, the cure is; therefore, guard yourself from its removal.

More difficult for one born near the kneecap, cut into the beginning of the flesh around in a round incision into the bone, and nearby will be one of those suitable grooves for this, and cure that within until it is healed.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of varicose veins, so they are.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are such, and they are thickened veins full of melancholic superfluities that occur in the parts of the body, and their greatest appearance is in the groins, especially in the groins of those who travel much, work much, and carry things.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Then you should administer a purge of the body from black bile several times with strong expulsion, and subsequently bleed the patient from the internal jugular vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	More importantly, the treatment for them is according to two methods: one is to incise and extract that black blood, and the other method is to elevate the vein and extract it entirely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The sectioning is done in this manner: wet the groin area with hot water until the thick blood is resolved, which is due to the heat of the groin. Then strengthen the area around the patient's thigh just below the inner part of the knee with a bandage on the outer side of the thigh. Next, dry the vein in one, two, or three places with a wide drying technique. Meanwhile, lift the black blood with your hand from the lower part of the groin up to its center and beyond, until the desired quantity of blood has drained out, which is sufficient to diminish the power of the malady.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then raise her up, and command her to abstain from foods generating black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And continue the cure through phlebotomy when the veins are full and this is noted by the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	Raise the limb in this manner: you should pull the thigh of the patient, if there are hairs on it, and then immerse the leg in warm water and rub the thigh with wet cloths until it becomes red and the veins are prominent; or exercise it with strong exertion if hot water is not available, until the limb is flushed.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then dry the leg along the vein by sectioning it or in its lower part you should cut it off.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then cut the leg with scissors and scrape the vein from all sides until you notice it, and observe carefully as that rope-like structure begins to turn black.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And then, as you cut the leg, you should see that white thing which is like a rope.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you place that leg elevated and bent at the knee, and suspend it on an cushion or lion skin.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then heat another part near that section for three days, and then scrape the knee from above the vein as it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that and incise the rear section of the leg, and then extract and elevate it as it is inserted through the second section, and then extract it from the section above that.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this as you extract it from the section that is higher up or above all sections, once everything is inserted; then incise that.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if you do not follow this to extract and elevate, then insert a strong double-threaded needle and tie that thread, extracting it. Or insert a rod and rotate your hand in all directions until it is inserted.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And make sure it is not incised; for if it is broken, it will be difficult to elevate that part and will have come down due to the damage.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when you have thoroughly washed it out, then place over the wound lamb's wool soaked in wine and olive oil, either well-filtered or not, and dress it so that it heals.
