And if the vein is contracted having tortuosity in which there is an envelopment at the parts, and it does not follow straightness as we have said, then cut over that entirely from the part of the tortuosity and at the locations of the envelopment, and place it suspended by ties so that you raise that entirely.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself in your section so that you do not cut the vein and that you do not damage it, for it will be difficult to raise that; use your prudence there.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incident where the vein is dried up:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a tie orp:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to be as with other ties (uncis) nor of sharp extremity so that it does not damage the vein; and it is of great flexibility like a lion, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein due to its subtlety; having this in its superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	From the extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in lands of calves as Al-Ategi describes in the land of Arabs and in the lands of India, in dry and barren lands with little endurance where no grass or trees grow.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And elsewhere in the body, this vein is generated other than in the calves.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And its generation is from putrefaction that breaks the chain as venom inside the body becomes serpents, vermin, and worms that generate between the chain and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And the sign of the susceptibility to the onset of this is when you encounter inflammation in the calf; then, nearby, the area becomes swollen; and soon after, the vein starts to protrude from the site of that swelling, seeming like a plant growing out.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And then, when the extremity appears, cover that area with a piece of lead weighing as much as one dragon. Two dragons' worth, and note it, leaving the lead suspended from the calf.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as often as some cause affects the parts outside, wrap this in lead and apply it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the wound is prolonged, then you incise a part of it and wrap up the remainder; and do not incise that which is inside while something is outside, for if you incise that, it will contract and enter the flesh, causing an abscess, inflammation, and a bad ulcer.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because the abscess should be treated thoroughly and extracted little by little, until it is expelled from the anus, and no cause should be left in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, some men have been stretched to the length of five or six palms and I have already been informed that one was stretched to twenty palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised during the time of its medication, then insert the needle into the vein and puncture that part along the length of the body, until all that is in the matter is evacuated. Then administer putrefaction to the area for several days with medicines; and cure that by the treatment of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has roots, and more especially when it appears at the joint of the foot or in the foot, and water flows into it through many openings, and is derived from each opening.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore treat it thus as we have said in the division and what was said above.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of the section on worms generated under the skin and it is called the cattle disease.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This illness is named in some lands as the cattle disease because many times it affects cows and there is a worm that is native between the bone and the flesh, and goes throughout the body up and down, and is shown by its own movement from member to member breaking through the bone and coming out.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And its generation is through the putrefaction of some humors, just as worms, snakes, worms, and ascarids are generated in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared because of its malice, for when it goes through the body and rises to the head, and reaches the vein, then greatly inflames it and enters and destroys the vein, and this happens many times.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And when you want to cure that and extract it, then do not fail to observe its circulation and appearance through sensation, then check what is on it and what is left it in firm compression and construction, and dry it thoroughly and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is palpated in the flesh and you do not find it, then place a cautery on fire over the area where it resides, and the main fear is corruption of it, which corrupts the area as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you find that it has reached near the heart, then apply strong strictures over the supraclavicular area, and dry it thoroughly, and extract it; and observe that the illness uses modification of its body through medicines that evacuate corrupt bad humors, and avoid foods causing putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section on the illness of gout.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called gout in our land, and it is a pain that occurs in some limbs, and often is displaced from limb to limb.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And now I have seen that which I shall recount to you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman at a village, and examined her arm and found a small swelling in the vein of the arm, and after being pressed for about an hour, I saw that this swelling rose up like a worm rising from below, albeit less urgently than feared, like greenish silver moving from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then I applied myself to the pain in that area and pressed it into the muscle, and placed my hand there for about an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then I corrected the other side of the body near where I treated the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I was asked to move herself all over her body as you could see; and it was too marvelous to observe the change in her and the speed of member to member.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before in my hands according to that manner, but I have seen movements where it is evident that the pain is being permuted from member to member.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But not all have such heels as in the female.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I do not consider it to be so, but rather that it is due to the fact that the female had a thin body and exposed veins, and in this case the sensation of that fullness has changed.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that there be no appearance of this backward curvature in those who are delicate and have soft, engorged veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And since you want the cure for it, and the patient feels that pain, if it does not appear as we have said regarding the heel, then strengthen that area and gently and thoroughly apply pressure to it until the constricted fullness is inserted, and cauterize the area.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in the heel, then cure that by discharging from the body and what you expel of fullness, and purge those with stinky pills and pills of sesame and similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	From the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diverse according to species, and according to the locations of the body in which they lodge, for their diversity is that some have large points, small, concave, and silent, being solid; and some have three angles, and of those to which belong tongues; and of those to which belong feathers.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the members and feet in which they lodge is according to two manners: for the members or are principal organs affected, such as the brain, the heart, the liver, the lungs, the intestines, the bladder, and their like; and therefore when it lodges in any of these members and appears to you signs of death, which cause I will explain soon, then you should avoid extracting that arrow in those where death is due to its location in the major organs, and when you do not appear these bad signs and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the member, then you extract it and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of poisoning are when the arrow lodges in it, passes through the bone, and is situated above the brain, which is on top of the skull, for it happens due to the strong poison, scotoma, vertigo, redness in the pupils, inflammation and redness of the tongue, spasms and confusion of understanding, and vomiting of bile. The patient feels a heavy head, with the speech cut off and the voice destroyed, and is situated at the site of the wound white moisture resembling powder, and from it appearing like an excess of fleshiness.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if you see these signs, then abstain from the cure and extraction of the arrow, unless it is outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	And the signs of the arrow when it is in the heart are that it is near the left nipple, and you feel a hard lump there which is not visible; and strong movement of the arrow seems like the pulse, and the flow of the dark bloody wound, and the coldness at the extremities, pallor of the face, and syncope; and therefore you would know that death descends totally hopeless.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung are spitting of bloody foam from the wound, and the vessels near the throat are engorged, and the color of the patient is changed, and he exhales a great spirit or sighs for air with difficulty.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if the arrow is in the periosteum which is in the foot, and the pain then is near the small bones, and causes a great and violent pain with much sighing, and not all the members' muscles are affected.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if you press on the arrow in the stomach, then strongly raise the part of the wound containing some undigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if you press on the arrow in the belly, and it is embedded there, raise some opening of the wound, or the flesh, or intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope for its cure by extracting the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow presses on the bladder, and urine flows out, and its process is due to some cause at the parts outside, and strong pain occurs in the wound, then know that it is fatal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Moreover, the other limbs such as the face, neck, shoulder, arm, helper muscle, spinal column, furcula, coxa, and the like parts resembling the limbs, are saved according to major dispositions when the arrow does not find vein nor artery, and is not a venomous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the nature of these arrows, so that you may understand from this about their treatment.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is that an arrow struck the eye of a man in one eye at the corner of his eyelid near the nose, and I extracted it from the other side, leaving the bone of his ear with him, and he recovered, and was not injured in his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew which struck him in the bone of his eye, leaving the eyelid, but the arrow was hidden and could not be removed except for a small extremity which adhered to its shaft, and it was a large arrow among the sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion made of iron on which there were no ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew recovered, and was not injured in his eye, which would have been badly injured.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man which was struck in the shoulder, and it was an Arab arrow, and that one with its ears; then I incised over it between two muscles, and it was submerged in his shoulder; then I dissected around it, and soon extracted it, and the Christian recovered.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And another arrow was extracted from a man which was embedded in his stomach, and I observed that he died from that; therefore, after passing thirty days and no change occurring due to his disposition, incised over the arrow and ligated thereon, and he recovered, and was not harmed by this accident.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And there was a man in whom an arrow pierced his back, and the wound had healed over it, and after approaching seven years, incised the arrow in the region of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And there was a woman to whom an arrow pierced her stomach, and the wound had healed inside it, and no change occurred in any of her natural operations, and the woman did not experience any harm from her operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And there was another man to whom an arrow pierced his face, and the wound had healed, but the arrow remained broken, not experiencing much pain, and appeared similar to this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the king's principal advisor, which was embedded in the middle of his nose and had slightly declined to the right side, with the entire arrow hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called for the cure of him near the wound within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And then you will find the wound of the arrow stretched out; and then you will inquire about the one that feels subtle and does not feel it; but he felt the puncture and put his right ear there, and then suspected that this puncture was at the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And apply the place to be applied with an attractive and digestive paste, believing that by placing it there, I will appear the location of the arrow, so that it dries on that.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not miss the significant location where the arrow hit; and continue applying the paste over it for several days without missing any spot; and meanwhile, the wound consolidates, and treat the damage from its extraction for a period of several days until one day I feel the arrow within its sheath and tell me this.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And then place a sharp corrosive medicine on the wound for several days until it opens up, and over the swelling, I will touch it, and find the tip of the arrow, which adheres to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then you adjust in the incision of the wound with that sharp medicine until I visibly see the tip of the arrow, and pass to my time within four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then, when the wound is sufficiently enlarged, and it is possible for me to insert the forceps into it, I manipulate that, and without hesitation, I do not cease to refine and invent various methods of this art until one day by chance I managed to grasp the arrow with descending forceps, according to which the shape will be described at the end of this chapter; after which I extracted it; and then I restored the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some doctors judged that the cartilage of the nose is not restored, but I restored it and the wound healed, and the patient was entirely cured without any defect in him.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recount to you the quality of extracting some arrows, so that you pause and consider this rule and significance of what I have not said, for the parts of this art and the definitions of those are not understood in the narration nor do they comprehend them freely.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise craftsmen compare a little about motion; and what is present about what is absent; and find new operation and new instrument for the descent of foreign causes when they occur.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not removed from the members in which they are inserted but according to two manners: either by attraction of the place where they entered; or by the contrary part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is removed by the place where it entered, or the arrow penetrates into a fleshly location and is then thrust in and out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if it does not obey to the sensation of the hour in which it was injected, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it can heal, and reduce the attraction to it and its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly, if it is inserted into bone and does not obey to your sensation, then leave it for a few days and repeatedly apply attraction and motion on any given day, and it will be removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey your attempt for some days, then know that you perforate in the circuit of the arrow at that place of the bone from which subtle travel subsists into the area where the arrow is magnified.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is fixed in the bone of the head and has already penetrated one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the malaise after some of those accidents which you call, then abstain from the extraction of the arrow and leave it there until its being settles for some days; or if the arrow reaches the cerebellum, then death is not prolonged for it.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not fixed in the bone of the chest but only in the chest and does not pass into the cerebellum, and remains as a malaise for some days, and you do not encounter any cause of those accidents, then you proceed with the extraction of the arrow and its remnants.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is firmly fixed and you do not obey your extraction, then you administer travels in the circuit of the arrow as we have recommended, and soon cure the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already hidden in the place of the body and hidden from sensation, then you inquire about that area, and if you feel it, then remove that with some instruments which are suitable for its extraction.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot reach it due to the depth of the wound and the length of the arrow, and here there are neither nerves nor veins, then you cut into the wound to enlarge it and make it possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if it is in the ear where it is lodged, then you expose the flesh in which it is embedded by cutting away all parts as much as you can; and use your ingenuity, if you cannot reach the evacuation of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and in the torsion of those areas where it must yield.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any location, then you use your hand or forceps at all parts where it can make it yield; and with subtle skill, ensure that the arrow is not broken and that it is made easy for its extraction and that of the wound.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot treat that in your hour, then you leave it for some days until the parts that are in the circuit of him heal, and then repeat that which is alleviated.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if it makes the patient's blood flow more, then you administer what we have said about cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And preserve your virtue in the incision of veins or nerves, or cords, and administer engen in every manner for the avoidance of the arrow; and do this with facilitation, tranquility, tardiness, and firmness as you have advised.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore make the arrow contract by itself so that the patient is according to the figure according to which you should place the tip of the arrow in him, for this is more advantageous.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if this is not possible for you, then administer what is possible for you according to the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows that are counter-thrown in the opposite direction of another part, or that have already acted on some part from within to the parts outside, or cause engorgement at the tip of the arrow due to pressure from the deeper part; then you extract it; and the extraction should be according to the quantity in which the forceps take hold; and then remove it, for it is made light by ejection.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If it is retained in the bone, then twist the knife according to the opposite direction so that the arrow presses into the bone, and enlarge it by inserting, and then extract it.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	If not, leave it for a few days, and then reinsert it where it is embedded.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft of the arrow is there, then push it into place.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	If the shaft is embedded and you want to administer an impulse, then insert it there. If it resists, stir with a concave tool so that its concavity enters the arrow's groove, and then push it into place.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	If the arrow is concave, then push it with a strong stirrup entering it, so that the arrow expands due to this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	If the arrow is poisoned, then make sure you concave all the flesh where it is located, if possible, and then treat it with what is appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow hits the foot, or the abdomen, or the bladder, or the side, and is nearby such that you can touch it with your hand, and it is possible to extract it from there, then extract it and carefully close the wound, and cure that area until it heals.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	The form of forceps to which arrows are attached:
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	If the ends are like the beak of an eagle, made such that they grasp the arrow so as not to let it slip.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And these are made in special sizes, large, few, and medium, according to the size of the arrow and its smallness, and the width of the wound, and its depth.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	The form of the concave part at this end is made like the claw of an eagle so that it facilitates the removal of the arrow from the wound, and propels that dull object:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Form of pressing of deaf extremity:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	thus, in order that the instrument may be eased into the concave arrow and pressed towards it.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	Of phlebotomy of the veins: Of which veins it is customary to perform phlebotomy, they are in chapter XVI, and there are two pulsating veins near the ears, which Alhacen calls auricular; two herbs that are prominently visible on the temples; two veins near the inner corners of the eyes, which are called angular; one vein in the middle of the forehead; one vein at the extremity of the nose; two guide veins at the neck; two veins on the upper lip; two veins on the lower lip; — these are the veins called algelic; and there are two veins behind the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are five; of which one is cephalic, and it is derived from the wild grapevine; the people call it “the vein of the head,” and it is a mixed vein composed of one branch of the basilic vein and another branch of the cephalic vein; they name that one "the vein of all the body," while the basilic vein, which is derived from the domestic grapevine, is called "citillary," and the common people call it "the vein of the abdomen"; one is the funicular, and it is placed over the elbow, and this is the one on which phlebotomy is performed, and it is the one that appears on the arm by a clear manifestation; and saphena, which is the vein between the said auricular and the small one mentioned, and it is in those two branches.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and thigh there are three veins; one of them is that which gives curvature to the curve of the wild deer's leg; the second is sophena, and its place is at the thigh of the domestic deer; the sciatic vein, and its place is at the thigh of the wild deer; and in the thigh there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The condition of the veins near the ears is cataris ancient, emigranea, sahafati, and ulceracios of the bad ancient headaches.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of sagnating those is according to what I will recount to you: it should be placed at the top of the patient's head, and the patient's head should be rubbed at the occipital region where both veins are near the ears with a wide cloth for good friction; then tightly tie the patient's own hair with a band in which the two appear, and their locations are close to the ears in two pressed areas of the head; and you should feel those at your right hand, and if you sense the pulse of those at your right hand here, test it by this method.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the surgical lancet, and that which is incised, and then you introduce it there into the groin between where the phlebotomy will reach the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	Then lift your hand above the vein and the groin towards the upper parts and incise the vein with an incising lancet.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And the length of the incision should be about two digits' width or around that; and let the blood flow out as much as you desire.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	Then strengthen with powders and leave that there until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already it was mentioned at the beginning of this book regarding the incision and their cautery.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	More than the two arteries that supply the temples with vitality, this condition is associated with ancient and malicious migraines, frequent eye strain, and a body burdened with acute internal inflammations.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those is according to what I will recount to you: constrict the patient's neck with your hand until the two veins appear clearly by palpation, and show the pulse at their location with your finger; then you can proceed.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then you elevate the codena above the vein at the parts superior to what you have just indicated, and insert the fleubotomi incidentally, and elevate the vein in them; and incise that likewise as you have done in the two other veins; and let the blood flow according to the quantity of your necessity.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then release the constriction of the malaise, and place your hand over the vein for an hour, and then place there powders and strengthen that above with a strong constriction, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And now the recollection of them has been preceded, and then the incision, and the extraction at the beginning of the libra.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the relief of the bloodletting from the vein of the forehead is similar to the cephalic bloodletting for ancient illnesses of the face and migraine, as well as swelling and foul ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the bloodletting from it is as I will recount to you; so, let the malaise strengthen its hold with a bandage through which the vein appears; and then take the instrument which is named the fossor, this is its form:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the puncture at the point where it is at the top of the drain over that vein and strike it either with your hand inclined or for some other cause in the manner of it, and let the blood flow according to the quantity you wish; then remove the perforation in the patient and strengthen it so that it may heal.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	Sometimes it is opened by lateral phlebotomy, but I do not know if the lateral phlebotomy is of such acute extremity as other phlebotomies, and instead is of subtil extremity, and phlebotomize there according to the transversal, for the bone is near and strong, so it would be broken by the phlebotomy when it is too thin.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	More the juvenile of the two veins that are at the lacrimal glands of both eyes through the hair of the eye by redness and pus in the eyes, and for facial illnesses.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	The quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient strengthens his color with a bandage, and then phlebotomize those veins, and you stand over the head of the patient.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And perform the incision for bloodletting according to the transversal length a little, making a few small incisions, for in that place there is no flesh; and if the incision is subtle, strengthen its extremity so it does not break.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And let the blood run until it is necessary, place your hand over those points, strengthen them for one night, and then remove them.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	More so the incision of the vein in the nose is appropriate for acute fever and intense thirst, as well as facial maladies, migraines, and rash that occurs on the face, especially when it is chronic.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the incision for it is that the patient holds his neck and almost presses his nose with his left hand, holding the subtle long incision tool in your right hand and placing it in the middle location of the nasal cavity according to the proper direction, because the vein does not appear here through sensation, and so blood begins to flow quickly.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Gently withdraw your hand from the incision little by little and let the blood flow according to your need; then place it there for one night, because that area is restored rather quickly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	May the youth of the femoral incision lead to constriction of the veins and to the beginning of leprosy and various ill health conditions and bad, corroding ulcers similarly as in phlebotomy.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient feels each cut in his thigh; and the surgeons are over the head of the patient, and the patient lies on a bench.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And gradually incise the vein along its length for a femoral incision, making it progressively smaller; and extract blood according to the season's quantity or according to what is necessary; and make a similar incision on the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then remove the flesh and firm the two veins with a middle string so that the patient is not overheated, and leaves in the wound until the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the benefit of the femoral incision for the algirich veins, apply to small abscesses and pustules in the mouth, corruption of the gums, bad ulcers, and fissures, as well as bad ulcers that are in the nose and around it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that you make a cut in front of the malade, strengthen its neck with a bandage, and then revolve the labia and look at two veins, of which one is on the right side of the labium and the second on the left; the demonstration of each is by the blackness of each of both, and this more is found in the circuit of those small dark veins; then incise each by an incisive incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	And if doubt exists, you, and you do not know which is of those, then understand the incision of the larger one of those, and of the more obvious one.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the appearance of the two veins that are in the labia above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	And it is customarily better to incise both veins that are in the labia.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	And of the two veins that are left, the treatment is near the femoral incision in preparations that are in the inguinal region, for the disease of the uvula, and diseases of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of performing a femoral puncture is to follow the patient's thigh in front of the groin, elevate the artery within it, and observe its tongue, from one side of the vein and the other side of the vein, and the color of each is gradually turning black.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And then perform a femoral puncture on each side; and beware that you do not complete the puncture on those, as they are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are punctured in the groin are those in which blood flows commonly in all men, and the puncture of them is made according to two methods: either place a small round metal probe or an olive stick subtilizing; or make a surgical puncture with a lancet, which they call a needel; and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this lancet is to be sectioned and of those its species are thin and subtil according to the width of the veins and according to the structure of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of femoral puncture with a mirtilat:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the wound be like this you see, and you need to open the concave veins full of apparent large vessels, and at those that contain thick turbid blood.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	This is the way to perform an olive bleed:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this fistula operation is of lesser width and has a finer extremity, and it suits the fistula of fine veins containing subtle citrine pus.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	May the operation of the basilic vein, which is one of three veins: from which we extract the pus from the illnesses that affect the arm, the elbow, and the foot and leg.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it suits the fistula operator, when performing that fistulotomy, to guard well and be overly careful there, for if he misses or misaligns in the puncture of the fistulotomy, he will cut the artery and cause flows of pus, so that one must not perform a fistulotomy with a pointed puncture before cutting as with a lancet.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit. E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the basilic vein in the right arm is related to ailments of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the quality of phlebotomy from this vein is that you should firmly grasp it with your hand or with another, rather than keeping it more in trailing water, until the vein becomes swollen and clearly visible; then quickly perform the phlebotomy; and if you cut through it completely, no harm will come of this.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And conserve that you do not finish placing your hand at the femoral puncture, but leave it with the nerves of the fingers naked and devoid of flesh.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And then immerse your hand in the water basin and let the blood flow in it, for if you do not immerse that in the water basin, the blood will coagulate in the orifice of the vein, and this is prohibited from flowing.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And when the blood is extracted according to the necessary quantity, then pause over the vein with oil and salt, so that it will not be completely consolidated; similarly ensure that you do this for the entire length of the vein.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	Moreover, the youth of the femoral puncture on that side of the hand is that it is applied to the diseases of the thigh.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And do similarly in the femoral puncture on the other side as you have done on the other.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	And the youth of the femoral vein from the puncture is for diseases that are in the lower part of the body, such as diseases of the thigh, and retention of menses, and for diseases of rashes and ulcers of thighs and old sores, and for their similar diseases.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the quality of the femoral incision is that the patient's foot enters into cauda and makes friction over which the veins appear; a cord is placed at the joint of the foot; the place of the vein should be clearly identified by the said touch, and from there its branches on the face of the foot are felt.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	And thus make the femoral incision wider or place the cord at the site where you identify the vein, which is better and more secure.

And if you make the femoral incision on the face of the foot, then you must guard against the nerves that are left on the face of the foot, and place your incision over the area where you make the puncture, as if you were to incise it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And let the femoral incisions be vertical.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the discharge of blood is prohibited; then you wet the foot in cauda water and let the blood flow in that area until it is evacuated.

And if the femoral incisor errs in the first attempt, then iterate with the femoral incision a little more, for the location is secure. E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And for the sciatic vein, the place is as we have said; you should make the incision leaving the rib of the part intact.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the indication for phlebotomy of the leg is pain in the hip when it is due to venous obstruction.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy for the leg is that the patient enters bathed, exercises and strengthens the thigh with a bandage made of a thin cloth wrapped around from above the hip to just below four fingers, so that it is not noticeable.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And when it becomes apparent, then phlebotomize there according to whatever means are at your disposal and according to the transversum, which is better; or incise there for an incision, or evacuate it by suction, for the place is sound.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is often more easily found in men; and if you find it but do not notice it by touch, then phlebotomize some branch of it, and that is the one that appears on the back of the foot between the auricular and the annular toes.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And guard the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then release the tension and place your hand over the area of the phlebotomy firmly, so that it heals easily.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	For ventilation and the qualities of using those.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventilations are of corns, or of worms, or of fire.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventilation is done in two ways: one way involves incision and bloodletting, and the other is through ventilation without incision.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventilation that involves incision is done in two ways, which can be either with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And for the ventilations that are administered with incision and bloodletting, there are fourteen places of the body, of which one where ventilation is paused is almost always the last part of the head; and the middle place of the two parts of the neck together; ventilations of the chin leave the jaw below and the mouth above; ventilations of the cheeks leave the mandible below and the mouth above; ventilations of the armpits, which are on the side of the shoulder blade; ventilations of the lumbar region, which is over the end of the ribcage; ventilations of the iliac bones, which are two handbreadths long; ventilations of the tibiae; and ventilations of the thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And do not extract the blood from the artery but from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and by this do not damage its virtue as with venesection; nor should you believe that phlebotomy is done by fire or several fires in any illness caused by congestion where the whole body must be evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes to phlebotomy for illness or for continuity, administer it at the beginning of the month and at the end, and in the middle of the month and at any time.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause is that in those men in whom blood is multiplied within them and who suffer from the extraction of it by phlebotomy with great severity; and among them are those who find congestion and redness in their face and head, and in their neck; and among them are those who feel pain in their face and forehead with darkness and dullness in their eyes; and among them who lose the site of their phlebotomy; and among them whose laughter is multiplied; and among them who find a taste of blood in their mouth, or whose tongue swells and they spit blood; and among them whose sleep is multiplied, and those who see blood in their sleep as red spots and plaques and other causes like theirs.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And when times in any cause of those, and properly if it is in the third or fourth part of the moon, then command ventilation to be made rather after passing one or two hours.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the purpose of ventilation of the neck is when you apply gravity to the head and what is embedded in the heels; more correctly that this should be close to the total evacuation of the body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventilation is in the place for phlebotomy of the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not recommended to use that which is inflamed or in which there is a cold, as it gives great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And for this, it is not advisable to use those that are inflamed, in which there are gouty affections.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	More for that which remains inflamed, it causes oblivion; and for this, you should command the ventillator to place his hand slightly on the ventosa at the affected parts, to prevent the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	More ventilation of alkahel is in the place of femoral and basilica vein phlebotomy: and by this you contribute to asthma, and to the constriction of air and to the rupture of the windpipe, and to coughs, and to fullness.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And ensure that the alkahel ventoz is slightly inflated, for if it is paused, it engenders weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the ventilation of alhagdahan contributes to headaches, ophthalmia, migraines, and toothaches; it is in the place of femoral phlebotomy.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And ensure that you command the ventozador not to press his hand at the scarification so as not to incise the artery and damage the flow of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias. E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventilation of the two openings inside the flasks contributes to the effect of the femoral, jugular, and cephalic bloodletting, for it draws the blood from all those veins that are in the flesh, and those fine veins among the larger ones through which the attraction reaches the three veins.

E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventilation whereupon the wind is directed over the hocks and contributes to the hemorrhoids of the buttocks and the ulcers, and leave them so.

Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	More wind from the legs diminishes manifestly, which carry the sickness from the whole body, and alleviate ancient pains of the hips and the stomach; and they provoke menstruation, and alleviate bloat and acid; and are in place of a double femoral lancing, and hanged, and of two calves.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	But they thicken the whole body and cause syncope in many people.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And from the winds they hanged the youth near the winds of two hips.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the winds is that you place the wind near the beginning view and suck out the air with a slightly moistened suction, and do not prolong the position of the winds, but rather pause them lightly, remain them continuously, and let the humors come to the area by chance equally.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to repeat this until you see the area already turn red and swell, and the sign of the sickness appear.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you incise and gradually increase the suction, and place the body in a suitable position.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	And for a man who has tender skin, incise him only once and not further, so that the wound does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the fan to increase the incision and slightly enlarge it, and adjust the suction to facilitate it.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the wound becomes infected, then incise twice; in the first incision, open the way for fluid drainage from the wound and its pus.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second incision, perform a thorough examination before draining the infected pus.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the wound is mixed with feces, then make the third incision to ensure it drains properly.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the pus little by little or just a small amount, suffice with one incision.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want extraction of bad blood, we make a cut with a scarifying incision; and if we know that the blood is thick, then we must scarify by scraping.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which only the depth of the incision is used.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the part where the incision is thick, hard, dark, and its pores are straight, then the places for the suction cups should be gently anointed with open resolving oils; if it is in summer, such as olive oil of aloes or olive oil of violets, or balsam oil, or myrrh oil; and if it is in winter, then use narcissus oil, or lavender oil, or chamomile oil, or blood oil, and to those similar.

Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	Moreover, if the suction cup is on flesh with wide pores, then it should be prohibited from oil, and instead, the areas near the suction should be washed with cold water or fresh sweat water, or vinegar water, or grape leaf water, and similar to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for that of which the pain is due to a humid nature, wash his bowels with warm wine, or with water of myrtle and sumac and similar.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for that of which the superfluities are large, wash his bowels with old wine, or with water of santewort, which is marjoram, or of decoction of dill, or of chamomile, and similar to them.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.
